properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A heat event is expected to continue through Sunday. A hot airmass is bringing temperatures near or above 30 degrees with overnight lows in the mid to high teens for the next few days. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid airmass remains in place over parts of southern Manitoba today. Daytime highs in the low 30s combined with high humidity will result in humidex values in the upper 30s today. A cold front moving through the region Wednesday night will flush out the humidity and bring cooler air into the region for the rest of the week. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. For more information on heat and your health: - Visit Manitoba Health at: http://www.manitoba.ca/health/publichealth/environmentalhealth/heat.html. - Call Health Links – Info Santé at 204-788-8200 or toll-free at 1-888-315-9257. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-18T11:59:14-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential significant rainfall tonight through Thursday night. A few rounds of thunderstorms will soak the region tonight through Thursday night. Total rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm are possible with higher amounts in areas that receive multiple thunderstorms. Environment Canada is closely monitoring the situation for potential rainfall warnings. Severe thunderstorm watches have been issued for some areas. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-18T12:15:50-00:00

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots, frequent lightning and hail. Thunderstorms are expected to develop late this evening along a cold front. Some of these storms have the potential to become severe. The main threats are wind and hail. There is also a chance of risk of an isolated tornado. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-18T09:14:41-00:00

Area: Lake of the Woods
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:14 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is currently located near Manigotogan and is tracking to the northeast at 40 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-18T00:36:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-17T22:15:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1932631572.2020
Area: Manigotagan Black River Res. and Hollow Water Res., Little Grand Rapids and Atikaki Prov. Park, Bloodvein

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

This severe thunderstorm is located between Elma and Red Rock Lake and is tracking to the northeast at 45 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Fast-moving water across a road can sweep a vehicle away. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Hazards: - Damaging wind gusts of 90 to 110 km/h - Quarter to ping pong ball size hail - Risk of a tornado Locations: Portions of far Northern Ontario including Big Trout Lake, Webequie, Attawapiskat and Winisk River Provincial Park. Timing: This afternoon into this evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-06-18T02:03:38-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:06 p.m. CDT (5:06 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to golf ball size hail. A severe thunderstorm is located 45 kilometres east of Webequie, moving east at 80 km/h. Hazards: Golf ball size hail and 100 km/h wind gusts. Another severe thunderstorm is located 5 kilometres east of Wapikopa Lake, moving east at 70 km/h. Hazards: Quarter size hail and 90 km/h wind gusts. Locations impacted include: Webequie, Wapikopa Lake and Chipai Lake. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2020-06-17T23:53:40-00:00
